intro: Scottellia klaineana, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
